solution_line_template: Harry ran {monday_speed} x {faster_percentage_tue_thu} = <<{monday_speed}*{faster_percentage_tue_thu}={speed_increase_tue_thu}>>{speed_increase_tue_thu} meters per hour faster on Tuesday to Wednesday.
So he ran {monday_speed} + {speed_increase_tue_thu} = <<{monday_speed}+{speed_increase_tue_thu}={tue_thu_speed}>>{tue_thu_speed} meters per hour from Tuesday to Thursday.
Then on Friday, he ran {tue_thu_speed} x {faster_percentage_friday} = <<{tue_thu_speed}*{faster_percentage_friday}={speed_increase_friday}>>{speed_increase_friday} meters per hour more.
Therefore, he ran {tue_thu_speed} + {speed_increase_friday} = <<{tue_thu_speed}+{speed_increase_friday}={friday_speed}>>{friday_speed} meters per hour on Friday.
